channel.title: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?
channel.description: Well today i had further maths and it sucked right, its at a different school and it doesnt finish till 5. Music tech i sat in today with my mate coz i had a free period, and it was awesome, it was all about various music and how it was made with what techniques and computer help it was amazing. Plus theres a girl there with tits almost the size of bowling balls. anyway i was thinking about it but i dunno.

item.title: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Mopman:

Music Tech is welcomed by uni’s actually, pretty well if you’re going into an Audio Engineering or Sound Tech degree.

Are you sure about this? All the music boffins I hang around with at college say the exact opposite.

Read full topic
item.source: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?

item.title: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

I used to be able to read music and can still sort of read it but i can learn it again easily, and at university i am planning to do computer prorgamming/ games design so further maths isnt essential because i already take maths

Read full topic
item.source: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?

item.title: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Music Tech is welcomed by uni’s actually, pretty well if you’re going into an Audio Engineering or Sound Tech degree.

It depends if you need maths for your degree. What do you plan on doing at Uni? If you don’t need Maths, and can read music (pretty important, at least to my Music Tech class) then go for it, it’s fuckin’ fun. You’ll never have so much fun doing coursework as Music Tech

Read full topic
item.source: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?

item.title: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

I quit Maths, can’t stand it.
Do what you want to do, after all you’re the one who has to take the classes.

Read full topic
item.source: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?

item.title: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

well i do still take normal maths aswell and i think it is possible for me to take both because a mate of mine is in all of my lessons cept for further maths and he takes music tech so it would slot in nicely
Further maths is always 6th period and doesn’t finish till 5 every time, admittedly half the time it still is at my school but its wanky

Read full topic
item.source: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?

item.title: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Well further maths is probably the harder course and therefore recognized by more universities.
And then Music tech is something that’ll be more fun but probably wont be welcomed by most universities.

I’d say stick with further maths but your circumstances seem like that’d be the sucky answer.

Read full topic
item.source: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?

item.title: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?
item.dc:creator: @Matty_m Matty`m
item.description:
@Matty_m wrote:

i took music tech for my options, it’s trully great.

but as spel said maths is overall >

item.title: Should i drop further maths for Music tech?

Try get both. Overall math is more important.
